title.narrative: Support to DIGNITY - A World Without Torture

description.narrative: The purpose is to end all torture in the world
FL §06.32.08.40 DIGNITY - Danish Institute Against Torture

Number of people at community level with increased protection from violence.

2.2 Strengthening state and local authorities and civil society actors to prevent violence in communities
Number of people at community level with increased protection from violence.

target.value: The chain(s) of positive changes recorded in year one is continued in year 2; at least one new chain of positive change reflecting increased trust (e.g. better relations, cooperation and higher participation) is recorded in a new community (group or setting)
Chains of positive changes are continued. At least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance no lower than '3' by peers per community.

Chains of positive changes are continued. At least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance 4 or 5 by peers per community; in addition, at least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance no lower than '3' by peers per community.
At least one chain of positive change is recorded per community reflecting increased trust (e.g. better relations, cooperation and higher participation).

title.narrative: 1.2 Strengthening state authorities (prisons, police, and criminal justice system) and civil society actors to prevent torture and CIDPT

Number and descriptions of civil society actors undertaking specialized measures related to identification, documentation, reports and/or referrals for legal, medical, and mental health services for an increased and more diversified4) number of survivors

target.value: The chain(s) of positive changes recorded in year one is continued in year 2; at least one new chain of positive change towards an increased and more diversified number of survivors reached.
Chains of positive changes are continued. At least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance no lower than '3' by peers in per country.

Chains of positive changes are continued. At least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance '4' or '5' by peers per organisation; in addition, at least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance no lower than '3' by peers per organisation
At least one chain of positive change is recorded per organisation towards an increased and more diversified number of survivors.

title.narrative: 1.1 Strengthening state authorities (prisons, police, and criminal justice system3) and civil society actors to prevent torture and CIDPT
Number and descriptions of state and local authorities undertaking protective and preventive measures addressing torture and CIDTP

target.value: The chain(s) of positive changes recorded in year one is continued in year 2; at least one new chain of positive change towards strengthened protective and preventive mechanisms is initiated with a new authority.
Chains of positive changes are continues. At least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance valued no lower than '3' by peers per authority.

Chains of positive changes are continues. At least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance 4 or 5 by peers per authority; in addition, at least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance no lower than '3' by peers per authority.
At least one chain of positive changes is recorded with 2 authorities in strengthened preventive and protective mechanisms.

title.narrative: 2.1 Strengthening state and local authorities and civil society actors to prevent violence in communities
Number and descriptions of local authorities taking steps towards violence prevention programmes, including through improved governance

target.value: At least one new chain of positive change towards engagement in violence prevention mechanisms is initiated with a new authority. The chain(s) of positive change in the first four countries is developed (vs 2021).
Chains of positive changes are continued. At least one chain of positive positive change is recorded with a significance no lower than '3' by peers per authority.

Chains of positive changes are continued. At least one chain of positive positive change is recorded with significance 4 or 5 by peers per authority; in addition, at least one chain of positive change is recorded with significance no lower than '3' by peers per authority.

At least one new chain of positive change towards engagement in violence prevention mechanisms is identified in a community. The chain(s) of positive change in the first three countries is developed (vs 2020).

title.narrative: 3.2 Strengthening state authorities and civil society actors to provide timely and quality rehabilitation to trauma affected survivors of torture, CIDPT and other forms of violence
Number and descriptions of state and non-state providers with increased capacity to deliver and/or teach quality rehabilitation services

target.value: Chain of positive changes towards increase in the number of providers of services is continued and has contributed to increased access to improved trauma-informed rehabilitation for trauma-affected survivors in at least 50% of DIGNITY’s programme countries

Chain of positive changes towards increase in the number of providers of services continued and has contributed to increased access to improved trauma-informed rehabilitation for trauma-affected survivors in at least 75% of DIGNITY's programme countries.

Chain of positive changes towards increase in the number of providers of services continued and has contributed to increased access to improved trauma-informed rehabilitation for trauma-affected survivors in at least 80% of DIGNITY's programme countries.

At least one new chain of positive change towards increase in the number of providers of services has contributed improved access to improved trauma-informed rehabilitation provided by state services or civil society actors in DIGNITY's programme countries

title.narrative: 2.3 Strengthening state and local authorities and civil society actors to prevent violence in communities

Number of cases where DIGNITY’s expertise has influenced decision-makers and stakeholders via provision of knowledge, implementation or innovation of the international framework on prevention of violence and advocacy, via research, publications, manuals, guidelines, reports multilateral institutions.

target.value: Number of cases of influence is increased by 15% vs baseline
Number of cases of influence is increased by 25% vs baseline
Significance of influence is rated 3 or higher by peers in 25% of cases.
Baseline number is available

title.narrative: 3.3 Strengthening state authorities and civil society actors to provide timely and quality rehabilitation to trauma affected survivors of torture, CIDPT and other forms of violence

Number and significance of cases where DIGNITY’s expertise has influenced decision-makers and stakeholders by provision of knowledge and advocacy on developing the normative framework for the right to rehabilitation and redress via research, publications, manuals, guidelines, reports and submissions to and/or engagement with local/national authorities and multilateral institutions.

target.value: Number of cases of influence is increased by 10% vs baseline: first indicators of influence in international fora.
Number of cases of influence is increased by 15% vs baseline: first indicators of influence in international fora and with a focus on Africa.
Significance of influence of DIGNITY is rated 3 or higher by peers in 10% of cases.
Baseline number is avaliable

title.narrative: 1.3 Strengthening state authorities (prisons, police, and criminal justice system) and civil society actors to prevent torture and CIDPT

Number and significance of cases where DIGNITY’s expertise has influenced decision-makers and stakeholders through provision of expertise on the implementation or innovation of the international framework on the prevention of torture and advocacy, through research, publications, manuals, guidelines, reports multilateral institutions.

target.value: Number of cases of influence is increased by 15% vs baseline
Number of cases of influence is increased by 25% vs baseline
Significance of cases of influence is rated 3 or higher by peers in 25% of cases.
Baseline number is avaliable

title.narrative: 3,1 Strengthening state authorities and civil society actors to provide timely and quality rehabilitation to trauma affected survivors of torture, CIDPT and other forms of violence
Number of trauma-affected survivors and families having been identified, referred to and received adequate rehabilitation

target.value: Increased number reached of 15 % vs baseline
Increased number reached of 20 % vs baseline
Increased number reached of 40 % vs baseline
Increased number reached of 10 % vs baseline
